intro: Indovethia calophylla, commonly known as the velvetleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and are clustered in racemes, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
